content: The Act may be cited as the "Social Security Caregiver Credit Act of 2014". The Social Security Caregiver Credit Act of 2014 acknowledges the importance of caregiving for family members and proposes a caregiver credit to support unpaid caregivers. It also highlights the need to address solvency issues in the Federal Old-Age and Survivors Insurance and Federal Disability Insurance Trust Funds. Additionally, a new section is added to Title II of the Social Security Act regarding deemed wages for caregivers of dependent relatives.
